intro: Alyssum oocarpum, commonly known as the broadleaf alyssum, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Brassicaceae, which includes mustard and cabbage plants. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale purple in color. Its leaves are alternate, ovate, and covered in fine hairs. Alyssum oocarpum is often cultivated for its ornamental value and ability to thrive in well-drained soils.
